citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility’s written program of veterinary care is incomplete, a written program is in place and is being followed for the
red fox but did not address exhibited birds. When asked about the program of veterinary care for exhibited birds the
facility representative stated that they did not currently have written program of veterinary care for the birds. All covered
animals present at the facility must be included on the written program of veterinary care to ensure that the licensee has
adequate information to provide appropriate veterinary care as directed by the attending veterinarian. The licensee must
consult with the attending veterinarian and develop a complete and accurate written program of veterinary care that
reflects the practices at this facility.

In one outdoor enclosure, housing two adult turkey vultures, there is an exposed power cord on the bottom of the
enclosure. In one outdoor enclosure, housing one adult rough legged hawk, there is an exposed power cord attached to
the interior of the cage. In one enclosure, housing two red tailed hawks, there is an exposed power cord coiled up on the
ground inside the enclosure. Electrical cords pose a significant health risk to birds that may chew or pull on them.
Unprotected powered electrical cords that are within a bird’s enclosure allows access to an electrical hazard that can
cause electrocution, injury and/or death. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that the birds are
protected from injury.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by Feb. 2, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility’s written program of veterinary care is incomplete, a written program is in place and is being followed for the 
red fox but did not address exhibited birds. When asked about the program of veterinary care for exhibited birds the 
facility representative stated that they did not currently have written program of veterinary care for the birds. All covered 
animals present at the facility must be included on the written program of veterinary care to ensure that the licensee has 
adequate information to provide appropriate veterinary care as directed by the attending veterinarian. The licensee must 
consult with the attending veterinarian and develop a complete and accurate written program of veterinary care that 
reflects the practices at this facility. 
3.153(a)(1)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In one outdoor enclosure, housing two adult turkey vultures, there is an exposed power cord on the bottom of the 
enclosure. In one outdoor enclosure, housing one adult rough legged hawk, there is an exposed power cord attached to 
the interior of the cage. In one enclosure, housing two red tailed hawks, there is an exposed power cord coiled up on the 
ground inside the enclosure. Electrical cords pose a significant health risk to birds that may chew or pull on them. 
Unprotected powered electrical cords that are within a bird’s enclosure allows access to an electrical hazard that can 
cause electrocution, injury and/or death. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that the birds are 
protected from injury. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by Feb. 2, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
